definitions.definition: being careful about what you say or do, especially to avoid danger or mistakes; not taking any risks
definitions.sensetop: cautious about somebody/somethingcautious about doing something

examples.text: The government has been cautious in its response to the report.
They expressed cautious optimism about a solution to the crisis.
He was very cautious about committing himself to anything.
examples.contextForm: cautious about somebody/somethingcautious about doing something

examples.text: She accused the government of being unduly cautious.
He warned us to be cautious of accepting their statements as fact.
Her experiences have made her cautious.
What's made you so suddenly cautious?

wordOrigin: mid 17th cent.: from caution, on the pattern of pairs such as ambition, ambitious.
